org.ertancg

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ertancg.RequestHandler

  • public class RequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RequestHandler(java.lang.String header, java.lang.String body, int threadID)
      This method creates a Database object and parses the 'Header', 'Body' parts of the HTTP Request.

      This method prints the desired logging messages.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(java.lang.String header,
                      java.lang.String body,
                      int threadID)
        This method creates a Database object and parses the 'Header', 'Body' parts of the HTTP Request.
        Parameters:
        header - is the Header of the HTTP Request.
        body - is the Body of the HTTP Request.
        threadID - is ServerThread ObjectID for logging purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • Handle

        public java.lang.String Handle()
        This method executes the request from the HTTP Request then @return's a HTTP Response according to operation.
        Returns:
        The HTTP Response.

      • respond

        public java.lang.String respond(java.lang.String body,
                                java.lang.String code)
        This method generates a HTTP Response by adding given @param body and @param code.
        Parameters:
        body - is the body of the HTTP Response.
        code - is the status code message of the HTTP Response.
        Returns:
        HTTP Response.

      • printLog

        public void printLog(java.lang.String msg,
                     int error)
        This method prints the desired logging messages.
        Parameters:
        msg - is the message to be logged.
        error - is the value to determine the type of the log. -1 for error, 1 for normal logs.

      • getRequestHandlerID

        public int getRequestHandlerID()
        This method @return's the ObjectID of this Object.
        Returns:
        The ObjectID of the Object.
